name: Raspberrypi <=> Arduino demo
body:
### Raspberry Pi <=> Arduino demo
This is a simple demo I wrote to introduce [ENSTA-Bretagne](www.ensta-bretagne.fr) robotics students to the [Raspberry Pi](www.raspberrypi.org) $35 computer.

It demonstrates the use of the [RXTX](http://rxtx.qbang.org) Java library to make the Raspberry Pi and the Arduino to talk to each other. The Arduino is connected to the Raspberry Pi via a USB cable.
A servo is wired on the pin 9 of the Arduino, and you can control it from the Raspberry Pi via a simplistic graphical user interface.

The Netbeans Java project is located in the SerialArduino/ folder, the Arduino sketch is located in the arduino/ folder.
You will find a pre-built jar in the dist/ folder. It needs the rxtx library to be installed to work.

```
$ cd RaspberryPi_SerialArduinoDemo/SerialArduino/dist/
$ sudo apt-get install librxtx-java
$ java -jar SerialArduinoDemo.jar
```
tagline: RaspberryPi and Arduino talking via a virtual serial port
